name: fluently
content:
fluently adverb
(SPEAK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 If you speak a language or read fluently, you speak or read easily, well, and quickly: I'd like to speak English fluently. Students are expected to read fluently in Arabic.
More examplesFewer examplesHe talked fluently and smiled easily.She speaks six languages fluently.Three-quarters of children were reading fluently by the end of second grade.

fluently adverb
(MOVE)
in a way that flows smoothly: The dancers move fluently across the stage. We passed the ball fluently and were in full control of the game.
More examplesFewer examplesThe team are moving the ball more fluently now.They dance naturally and fluently.
